algorithm_technique: Iterate through the Roman numeral string, checking for subtractive cases.
problem_summary_simple: Convert a Roman numeral string into its corresponding integer value.
problem_summary_technical: Process Roman numerals by mapping symbols to values and handling subtractive notation (e.g., IV, IX).
time_complexity: O(n), where n is the length of the Roman numeral string.
key_insights: Roman numerals are generally additive (largest to smallest).
Subtractive cases (like IV for 4) require special handling.
When a smaller numeral precedes a larger one, subtract the smaller from the larger.
A hashmap is efficient for mapping Roman symbols to their integer values.
